metadata.title: CVE-2016-7035 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An authorization flaw was found in Pacemaker before 1.1.16, where it didnot properly guard its IPC interface. An attacker with an unprivilegedaccount on a Pacemaker node could use this flaw to, for example, force theLocal Resource Manager daemon to execute a script as root and thereby gainroot access on the machine.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7035` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcib4 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.2
libcrmcluster4 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.2
libcrmcommon3 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.2
libcrmservice3 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.2
liblrmd1 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.2
libpe-rules2 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.2
libpe-status10 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.2
libpengine10 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.2
libstonithd2 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.2
libtransitioner2 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.2
pacemaker - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.2
pacemaker-cli-utils - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.2
pacemaker-common - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.2
pacemaker-remote - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.2
pacemaker-resource-agents - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pacemaker package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.14-2ubuntu1.2').
